jobs_requirement:
Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.
We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.
Job Summary
The purpose is to ensure tax legislation, mitigate tax risks, & provide expert tax advice & to ensure high quality in tax accounting & reporting. The tax manager is functionally responsible for tax specialist activities.
Responsibilities & Tasks
Manage direct tax
Manage indirect tax
Manage withholding tax
Manage transfer prices
Manage reporting, tax audit & compliance
Position Qualifications
Core Competences:
Accounting & Reporting
Financial Analysis
Local Taxation Knowledge
Financial Model Knowledge
Customer Finance Knowledge
Treasury Knowledge
Ericsson Knowledge
Business Understanding
Ericsson Business Processes Knowledge
English Skills
Fundamental Leadership Competence
Interpersonal Skills
Behavioral Competences:
Persuading & Influencing
Applying Expertise & technology
Analyzing
Working with people
Deciding & Initiating Action
Planning & Organizing

Bachelor in Business administration, accounting, finance and/or tax law. Experience in local & international tax legislation.
Knowledge in GAAP (i.e. local GAAP and IFRS), knowledge & understanding of financial systems.
At least 5 years work experience.
Additional Requirements, Physical Demands, Region/Local Specifications:
To be located in Malaysia.

jobs_title: RMED Rail Communications Systems Consultant, location Paris
jobs_requirement:
Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help shape a more sustainable world.
We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment where employees enhance their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision, core values and guiding principles. They share a passion to win and a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning and growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to reach your career goals.
Job Summary
We are looking for a Rail Communications System Consultant that can drive customer engagements from lead generation to contract fulfillment and secure that rail consulting projects are fulfilled with quality, in time & within budget.
You will work closely with the customer to be able to propose improvements & identify new business opportunities in rail communications.
In this role you will be part of a global team with highly skilled industry experts within the area of Rail.
The location of this position is in Paris, France. Your working domain will be primarily in Region Mediteranean and secondly global.
Responsibilities and tasks
Actively drive the growth of the sales funnel by identifying, defining and qualifying opportunities; this also includes driving the reuse and replication of global offering assets.
Proactively drive, in close cooperation with Customer Units (CU) and Engagement Practices (EP), the strategic customer dialogue on long-, medium-, and short-term topics to establish trust and build business partnership generating new sales opportunities.
Analyze customer & user offerings, market scenarios, customer go to market strategy.
Drive sales engagements
Perform up-selling & identify add-on sales opportunities
Deliver consulting projects, managing risks & time within consultant assignments
Develop consulting practice capabilities
Contribute actively to best practice sharing and knowledge management in the regional and global Industry & Society community. This entails actively train and educate in the service portfolio.
Contribute to a professional services culture and way of working characterized by strong customer focus, proactive attitude, teamwork, and strong performance ethics.
Qualifications and Experience Requirements
Experience in Technical Consultancy for GSM-R and Wireless Projects
Experienced in Support of tendering process for large scale opportunities
Can demonstrate ability to transform knowledge rail market as well as expertise in 4G wireless technology through presentation skills into customer solutions
Experience in working with rail industry consultants
Experience in working with ETCS/ERTMS projects
Knowledgeable in CBTC (Communication Based Train Control)
Experience in IoT (Internet of Things) network solutions.
Knowledgeable in LTE architecture
Well established personal network with C-level and sub C-level within the targeted customer segments on the regional market
Creative in terms of ability to see and make things in a new or different way, capability of developing inspiration, innovation or insight.
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to interface with all levels of the organization and an established relevant network within Ericsson.
Willing and available to travel frequently.
University degree in Business, or Engineering/ICT. Higher university such as an MBA considered a merit.
International work experience considered a merit
Qualifications and Experience Requirements
Core Competences:
åá Business Development Skills
åá Consultative Skills
åá Negotiation & selling skills
åá Project Management Skills
Behavioral Competences:
åá Entrepreneurial & Commercial thinking
åá Persuading & Influencing
åá Analyzing
åá Relating & Networking
åá Delivering Results & Meeting Customer Expectations
åá Adapting & Responding to Change
Preferred Skills:
åá Interpersonal skills
åá Consultative Selling Skills
åá Financial Understanding
åá Competitor Understanding
Closing statement
Capturing opportunities In the Networked Society everyone, everything and everywhere will be connected in real time. Our role is to help capture the opportunities that arise as a result of these developments. are driving innovation and sparking new consumer and producer behaviors, functionalities and even new business models.
As a leading ICT company, we will be a prime driver of transformation in the Networked Society. Today, we are on the brink of an extraordinary revolution. A world that is connected in real time will place many new requirements on us while opening up opportunities beyond our imagination. Those who have the ability to rethink, reinvent and innovate will be winners in this new value-creating ecosystem.
It's an exciting time to join our team and we need people to help us accelerate our business into the future. Our growth depends on the dedication and enthusiasm of our employees.

jobs_title: I&S ITS Rail Program Director RMED France
jobs_requirement:
This role defines the specific responsibilities of a Program Director to engage in both acquiring new Ericsson business and delivering on that business for assigned Customers within the area ITS, Intelligent Transport Systems, specifically focused and with experience from Rail.
Within the area of ITS Ericsson presently focus on Traffic Management, Transport Transactions and ICT Infrastructure.
This position is designed to bridge business, technical, & operations architectures in order to take Ericsson into new business. With a deep understanding of business functions, industry trends and technology, you‰Ûªll offer the industry insights and know-how that help drive innovative solutions to transform organizations. Working in close collaboration with Ericsson customers, you‰Ûªll be able to bring together diverse teams from across our global business functions to share knowledge and meet our customers‰Ûª individual delivery needs.
The role requires significant practical experience in the ITS market and specifically experience of regulatory environments, value chains, major stakeholders distribution system operators and/or Retailers and/or experience in telematics.
It requires a strong focus on business and customer management, across both customer needs and delivery.
Through deep ITS knowledge and strong delivery background the successful applicant will:
Build understanding of Customer‰Ûªs business issues through direct engagement and advocate this to the rest of organization
Build trusted relationship with Ericsson Key Account Manager (KAM) organization to allow direct engagements aligned with KAM ambitions
Develop comprehensive strategies and architectures to support the selling of transformation opportunities to our customers in alignment with KAM ambitions
Shape business requirements so that they can be translated into delivery roadmaps for the customer and business/technical solutions for Ericsson to deliver
Develop associated business cases and plans which reflect our deep understanding of the customer issues and pain points
Engage with Global, Regional and Local Ericsson teams to bring the best business solutions
Lead and hold accountability for the delivery of the business solution and related business processes.
Main activities:
Strategy input. Articulating needs from a customer/KAM on requirements to assist in sales process
Customer interaction. Developing knowledge of Customer and their issues
Ensuring responsive delivery of high quality presales and project assignments. Responsible for performance and quality of all assigned deliveries typically as Program Director
Develop deep expertise in Ericsson offerings and methodologies, creating re-usable assets and case studies. And wherever practicable leveraging Ericsson assets towards the Customer
Build competence. Articulating, identifying and building competence to be successful for assigned Customer
Coaching of project teams. Understanding your team and maintaining your team‰Ûªs motivation. Providing an attractive work environment to attract and retain staff
Building relationships within the organization and driving the ‰ÛÏone Ericsson‰Ûù behavior
Professional Skills:
10 Years Plus in a Senior Program Director or equivalent role in ITS market and specifically experience of regulatory environments, value chains, major stakeholders, business models/processes & operations in the transportation segment, distribution system operators and/or Retailers and/or experience in telematics in industry
10 ‰ÛÒ 15 years‰Ûª experience in industry, particularly with IS/IT Operations or working as an IS/IT Service Provider towards ITS segment.
Experience in scoping and supporting the sales team as a Core 3 team member or Core 3 support member on significant bids and deliveries (or equivalent)
Experience in working across business architecture and different technology domains with multiple solution architects and teams
Significant experience in Systems Integration.
Experience with Enterprise Architecture frameworks, like TOGAF, TMF Frameworx, and broad knowledge across industry frameworks, like SOA, ITIL
Project leadership skills with delivery of successful multi-staff Consulting and project assignments
Strong 3PP management skills across the end to end ITS Value Chain
The role requires solid understanding the ITS market and specifically experience of regulatory environments, value chains, major stakeholders, business models/processes & operations in the ITS industry, distribution system operators and or experience in telematics in ITS industry.
General Skills:
Enthusiastic, highly motivated and business-minded
Innovative, proactive, prepared to challenge and be flexible
Strong Customer and Results focus
Stakeholder management skills ‰ÛÒ relationship building and influencing within Ericsson KAMs, peers and Core 3 teams
Excellent time management and prioritization skills
Excellent coaching and people development skills
Good Consultative skills
Strong presentation and communication skills
Proven ability to engage senior executive customers to influence and negotiate outcomes
Role Experience:
Experience in developing ITS & ICT strategies based on:
Insight into Business & ICT cost and value levers, experience with IT Cost Reduction, Benchmarking, ICT Value Identification (Mergers and Acquisitions), ICT Workforce and Capability optimization
Understanding of business and ICT collaboration, experience with business analysis
Commercial (e.g. statements of work, service contracts) and Service integrator experience
Investment Portfolio Management experience desirable
Practical experience with Business & ICT transformation and ICT operations, IT Operating Model, Service Management Transformation, Solution Delivery excellence
Experience in identifying, developing and securing business and work assignments from external Ericsson customers
Delivery experience of project assignments for external Ericsson customers
Experience in delivery as a Business Architect / Enterprise Architect in the ITSM, Operations Support & Readiness, Fulfillment, Assurance, Billing & Charging, CRM Domains.
Specifically hold competence and experience of sales support & delivery in ITS sector
Industry Experience:
Good knowledge of Market, Competitors and Partners in both the ITS and the Systems Integration and Managed Service domains
MBA or similar experience in combined technology and business education
French and English fluency are required.
Position is based in Paris Area (Massy - 91) - France.

Cloud Solutions Expert (f/m)
At Ericsson, our vision is Networked Society where every person and every industry is empowered to reach their full potential. Our strategy to achieve it is founded on three pillars: Mobility; Broadband; and Cloud. Ericsson will do with Cloud what we have so well achieved with Mobility: a globally-scaled infrastructure roll-out play.
The ambition is high. That is why we are seeking ambitious and experienced individuals to accelerate the momentum in our region, which is made up of 16 countries and includes the following: UK, Ireland, Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland, Austria, Poland, Hungary, Slovakia, Slovenia, Croatia and Czech Republic. This role could be based at any Ericsson location in the region.
Job summary
Looking for a Cloud Solution Architect who is passionate to design and implement Enterprise/IT Cloud solutions. Excellent opportunity to work with and develop cloud service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and architectures (Private, Public, Hybrid) for Enterprises, Telecom Operators, etc.
You will have opportunity to work for many Telecoms and Enterprises customers on complex projects including full systems integration involving different hardware and software solutions.
Responsibilities
Act as Subject Matter Expert in specific technologies, product/service or solutions delivery
Design Cloud based solutions according customer requirements
Install and integrate Ericsson and other Cloud Solutions
Facilitate knowledge transfer to the customers during deployment projects
Work with the back-end teams to develop reliable solutions
Execute system tests
Create support documentation
Qualifications
Technical
Advanced knowledge of Cloud or Virtualization concepts and technologies
Working experience with deployment, configuration and operations of cloud management frameworks (OpenStack, CloudStack or VMware vCloud Director)
Working experience with some of virtualization platforms (VMware, KVM, XEN, Hyper-V)
Working experience with server infrastructure (blade systems or rack servers etc.)
Solid Linux system administration and troubleshooting skills
Good understanding of networking technologies and protocols
Advantage:
Practical experience with one of the following service architectures: AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Terremark, Rackspace, etc
Working experience with telecom specific cloud topics such as Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) or Management/Orchestration (MANO)
Working experience with some of enterprise storage systems - EMC, NetApp or similar
Knowledge of open-source storage solutions and distributed file systems
Experience working with Linux HA stack: pacemaker, corosync, keepalived
Knowledge of security infrastructure and concepts in Cloud
Knowledge of automation tools (Puppet, Chef)
ITIL knowledge
Soft
Expressed creativity and responsibility
Solutions-focused: creative, curious, positive, collaborative
Organizational awareness: establish power-base mapping to sensibly act and plan in accordance
Demonstrates teamwork in cross-functional teams

Job Summary:
This Job Role is responsible for the coordination, management and execution of proactive and reactive maintenance activities that require a higher level of support that the one offered by the 1st Level Operations for Transmission area. This shall ensure that the services provided to customers are continuously available and performing to Service Level Agreement (SLA) performance levels.
Responsibilities & Tasks:
Provide fault management on specific network nodes: point to point and point to multipoint microwave radio relays, SDH&DWDM MUX, ATMÌê switches
Perform preventive & corrective maintenance, problem management, acceptance and fault management and tracking
Logging the performed activities in specifically ticketing tools
Remote integration and configuration of transmissions network elements
Working for on-call schedule and night time
2nd Level Assurance Support Activities
2nd Level Incident Management
Problem Management
System Administration

General knowledge of one or more of: microwave(P-P,PMP), PDH/SDH/DWDM/DSL/ATM/FR/IP/ETH architectures & network topologies & standards

General knowledge of UNIX or LINUX operating systems is a plus
Preferred Qualifications & Experience Requirements:
Proven operating experience on Ericsson Minilink TN/Huawei RTN microwave, Huawei and Tellabs SDH is mandatory (remote configuration, support, troubleshooting)

Job Summary
This Job Role is responsible for the coordination, management and execution of proactive and reactive maintenance activities that require a higher level of support that the one offered by the 1st Level Operations. This shall ensure that the services provided to customers are continuously available and performing to Service Level Agreement (SLA) performance levels.
Job Description:
Manage networks and nodes within the Packet Switched domain and Evolved Packet Core of our customers. This includes:
2nd Level Preventive maintenance activities
2nd Level Incident Management activities
2nd Level Assurance Support activities
2nd Level Customer Experience Management activities
2nd Level Problem Management activities
2nd Level System Administration activities
Participate in project activities by implementing new configurations on EPC nodes
On regular base covering the 7x24 Call-out responsibility
Provide input, implement and verify improvements in processes
Verify and implement configuration changes
Ability to transfer knowledge to colleagues
Competence & Qualification:
Good understanding of PS and EPC architectures
Good understanding of GTP v1 and v2 protocols
Good understanding of following protocols: AAA, DIAMETER, RADIUS, NAT
In depth knowledge of operation and troubleshooting of EPG, SGSNMME, DNS, PCRF, DRA, NBG, Secure Gateway, Firewalls.
Understanding of IP routing protocols and MPLS
Cisco CCNA/CCNP certification is a plus
Scripting skills in Perl or Shell is a plus
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Presentation and Communication Skills
Ability to work under strong pressure related to scale of business impact
Bachelor/Master of science in Electrical Engineering, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent with minimum of 1 to 5 years of work experience

Job Summary
This Job Role is responsible for the coordination, management and execution of proactive and reactive maintenance activities that require a higher level of support that the one offered by the 1st Level Operations. This shall ensure that the services provided to customers are continuously available and performing to Service Level Agreement (SLA) performance levels.
Responsibilities & Tasks
2nd Level Assurance Support Activities
2nd Level Incident Management
Provide fault management on CORE IP nodes: Routers, Switches, Firewalls.
Perform preventive & corrective maintenance, problem management, acceptance, fault management
Logging the performed activities in specifically ticketing tools
Create/correct data transcript files to configure or update the existing network elements or to add new network elements
Performance monitoring and QoS analysis of node performance
Working on-call schedule and night time
Minimum Qualifications & Experience Requirements:
Excellent communication skills in both English and Romanian, ability to interact with customers and internal stakeholders, and provide technical solutions.
Solid understanding of service provider networks, internet network architecture and routing products like BGP, OSPF, ISIS.
Good experience MPLS Layer 3 VPN and Layer 2 VPN/VPLS is a must.
Cisco CCNP, CCNP SP is a plus;
Juniper (JNCIA , JNCIP-SP) certifications is a plus;
Huawei HCNA, HCNP certification is a plus;
Understanding of Broad-band Remote Access Protocols like PPP, DHCP, AAA, RADIUS and Mobile Networks like GGSN/SGSN/LTE, CPG is a plus.
General knowledge about Mobile Network Architecture (GSM/WCDMA/LTE)
General knowledge of UNIX or LINUX operating systems is a plus
Preferred Qualifications & Experience Requirements:
Strong problem solving skills and analytical thinking
Ability to work under stressful situations, meet tight deadlines and deliver services with high quality
Excellent communication skills
Knowledge sharing ability
Service fulfilment
Self-motivated
Open minded

Job Summary
As a member of the core Big Data and Analytics practice, you will work with Top Talent, across the Globe, in new and cutting edge technologies to develop the intuitive solutions of the future. The Team in Ericsson creates solutions which will influence the future of living and enables our customers to create intuitive and personalized products for the marketplace. A few illustrative solutions areas are the Internet of Things, Next gen Networks and Intuitive Customer Experience, Next best action and Connected Cars. You will work collaboratively with diverse teams of Business Analyst, Big Data Architects and Data Scientists and contribute to generating actionable insights and thereby converting data into knowledge of commercial/Societal value.
Responsibilities & Tasks :
Must have a strong understanding of the design, development and deployment of business intelligence systems and large scale data warehouses using BI tools and commercial database platforms like Oracle, SQLServer and Teradata. Working experience with Big data ecosystem will be considered as added advantage.
Ability to transform business level requirements to efficient dashboards and visualizations
Create data warehouse design patterns, designs, standards, and templates
Identify problems, develop ideas and propose solutions within differing situations requiring analytical, evaluative or constructive thinking in daily work and for assigned programs and projects
Prepare and present ideas and recommendations to colleagues and upper management
Apply conceptualized and creative-thinking expertise toward possible reporting solutions or alternatives
Hands-on development using Tableau/Tibco Spotfire to create dashboards & reports and use as standard templates
Define and implement BI management procedures
Design and implement BI metadata and data dictionary design and standards
Define and manage schema objects for Tableau /Tibco Spotfire projects
Document systems through object models, data definitions and naming conventions
Ability to write reports, documentation and speak effectively before groups of business and IT personnel
Should be able to articulate issues and solutions clearly and be a very good communicator with excellent Oral/written, presentation and articulation skills.
Desired Skills and Experience :
Must possess Seven (7+) years of experience in Information Technology with a technical background
Four (4+) years of experience in BI reporting Development (2+) years of experience in developing Tableau / Tibco Spotfire based business intelligence systems and large scale data warehouses
Understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence concepts
Must have strong Tableau / Tibco Spotfire and database skills
Must be able to travel to client locations
Required Personality Traits :
Ability to quickly learn new concepts/technologies with minimal handholding
Good collaboration and communication skills
Excellent problem solving skills and ability to shape an undefined problem statement
Strong sense of team work, ownership, and accountability
Takes initiatives and self-motivated
Job Location : Kolkata/Delhi/NCR

jobs_title: Public Safety and National Security Consultant- Bucharest OR Sofia
jobs_requirement:
Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is world‰Ûªs leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet‰Ûªs greatest challenges.
Ericsson is strongly committed to leveraging on its existing portfolio and competence to address customer needs beyond the traditional Telco customer with a focus on Energy, Utilities, Transport, Automotive, Shipping and Public Safety & Security.
We are now looking for further industry experts and leaders to support us in growing our sales in industry verticals.
In this role you will be reporting to Head of Global Safety & Security Global practice and be part of a global team with highly skilled industry experts within the domain of Safety & Security.
This position can be based in Bucharest/Romania OR Sofia/Bulgaria.
Job Summary
Drive or participate in customer engagements from lead generation to contract fulfillment, secure that consulting projects are fulfilled with quality, in time & within budget. Work closely with the customer to be able to propose improvements & identify new business opportunities.

Position Summary
The Role
In order to create products to move Ericsson into the IT/Hybrid Cloud market, we are forming small, incubator R&D teams aligned with key areas of the Cloud 2.0 architecture. The incubator teams will work with PA Cloud and strategic 3PPs to innovate, enhance and productize components and appliances for IT Cloud usage.
You will be one of the founding members of the Data Storage team, who will, together with the team leader, set the direction, architecture and drive early results. Everybody on the team is expected to grasp the market pain-points, contribute to architecture and deliver code. This role is based in San Jose, CA.
REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications
Technical competence
- BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related field
- Have a minimum of 10 years as a software engineer
- Have a minimum of 5 years working on storage and data products
- Experience building sophisticated and highly automated data services (MapReduce, Datawarehouse, Time Series, Object Stores et al)
- Experience with ZFS
- Know, understand and are interested in distributed systems, scalability, operating systems, networking, automation and governance
- Have experience with open-source projects and a track record of contributions to open-source communities, for example, ZFS, CloudFoundry, Docker, Linux, OpenStack et al.
- Take pride in their code and appreciate feedback, discussion, and iteration with experience in driving a vigorous code review process
- Value testing and understand how to safely and continuously deploy into production environments
- Get a warm and fuzzy feeling from Postel‰Ûªs Law
- Write code in several languages (C, C++, Java, Go, node.js/javascript), have switched their main language at least once in their career and have expertise in C, Go and javascript.
- Experience in Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA and REST)
- Can describe the difference between concurrency and parallelism
- Prior success in automating a real-world production environment
Industry competence
- Possess a strong understanding of the cloud computing (datacenter, hardware, IaaS, PaaS, cloud services) industry
Leadership competence
- Have an entrepreneurial spirit
- Strong results orientation
- Thinks big
- Self-aware, self-motivated and self-learning and encourages the same in your teams
- Strong track record in people leadership
- Has passion and convictions and the innate ability to inspire passion in others
- Genuine interest in people and leading people
- Ability to lead, inspire and coach team members
- Expects and requires innovation of her/his team
- Encouraging learning and the sharing of best practice
- Excellent communication skills in English, spoken and written
- Ability to apply structure, simplify and drive change in a multi-site, multi- cultural environment
- Using data driven analyses to drive insight
- Has relentlessly high standards

Job Summary
The purpose of the Mediaroom (IPTV) Support Engineer (SE) position is to provide customers with reliable technical solutions to the complex integration problems associated with the Mediaroom solution built on the Microsoft platform. This Support Engineer position focuses on the IPTV product Mediaroomå¨ (IPTV = Internet Protocol Television). As a technical resource working with our Mediaroom operators and partners, you will be minimally required to have solid technical expertise across Microsoft enterprise products like Windows Server, SQL Server, System Center tools, and strong troubleshooting skills with technical depth in at least 2 areas of technology utilized by the Mediaroom platform. Microsoft SQL Server troubleshooting and architecture expertise with knowledge of Mediaroom is currently the primary skillset needed by our team.
At a high level, candidates must have exceptional customer service, problem solving, and communication skills, and the ability to work in a team environment. Must have sufficient technical depth to communicate with development, field, and other internal organizations at a peer level as well as convey technical concepts to non-technical individuals. Must possess the ability to work with minimal supervision and operate as a self contained business unit within the Mediaroom team.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Lead the investigation and isolation of unique and challenging problems, collaborate with product development teams and other support groups to devise a plan for resolution that meets the customer‰Ûªs needs.
Maintain high levels of customer satisfaction, both external and internal customers.
Delivery of support within predefined service level agreement.
Define methods and process to lead both customers and internal resources through technical issue deconstruction and analysis.
Provide direction to others on the management and analysis of issues, review solutions, review technical documentation for accuracy and depth, and deliver technical training.
Interact with Support Ticketing, Bug Tracking and Knowledge Management systems to share incident and error information in a consistent format on a timely basis.
Report software bugs to product groups. Advise on potential software improvements during the design and pre-release process.
Participate on On-Call rotation with your peers six months after start date with the team.
Mediaroom Support Services provides 24 x 7 x 365 support. Off-hours support, evening, and weekend shifts will be required on a rotation basis with other team members. Travel of 10-30% may also be required.
Required Professional and Communication Skills, Behaviors:
English fluency both verbal and writing is essential.
Previous Mediaroom technical support experience is highly desirable.
Junior-Senior engineer level experience is preferred with focus on Microsoft platform servers (5+ years troubleshooting Microsoft server platform software).
Experience working with and supporting Enterprise and/or Telco/Cableco customer base.
Works effectively in situations involving uncertainty, change, or lack of information.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Self-starter with ability and ambition to work remotely, or possibly onsite with a specific customer for extended or dedicated periods of time.
Ability to work across groups by setting mutual goals, ensuring clarity of roles, and working together in ways which enhance business effectiveness.
Proven ability and ambition to quickly learn new technologies and underlying technologies to more effectively support the breadth and depth of the Mediaroom TV platform.
Spanish or Portuguese language speaking and reading/writing capabilities are a plus.
Technical Knowledge:
Has detailed, hands-on understanding of knowledge/skill in two or more of the following areas and is able to apply it effectively when managing/troubleshooting customer problems:
SQL Server (Performance Analysis and Query Design, Clustering, DB Management/Admin, and interaction with Web Services),
Windows Server (OS, AD, IIS, PKI, .Net Framework, Web-Services, Clustering technologies, Hyper-V),
System Center tools (Operations Manager, Configuration Manager, Virtual Machine Manager),
Troubleshooting Techniques and Tools (PSSDiag, DebugDiag, NetMon, Message Analyzer, WireShark, IIS Logs, Event Logs, TSReader, etc.),
Knowledge of Managed and Unmanaged code, related troubleshooting, and PowerShell scripting,
Troubleshooting capability with common Audio-Video delivery formats; such as MPEG, Microsoft Debug (User and Kernel mode) tools knowledge and troubleshooting skills.
Spanish or Portuguese language speaking and reading/writing capabilities are a plus.

Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will be connected. We believe our commitment to sustainability creates enduring value for people, business and society. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.
We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & and an innovative & and engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. They share a passion to win & and a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. Job Summary
In Ericsson Global Services we have formed the automotive team in the Industry & Society Center of Excellence (CoE). We are a team of professionals focusing on developing engagements and offerings towards the automotive customer segment.
The focus of the unit is solution architecture, solution delivery and the support of the sales process towards the automotive customer segment. Examples of services we develop and deliver are Telematics, Fleet management, Connected Safety, Infotainment, Analytics and Connectivity.
The consultant will work with projects and consulting engagements in sales and delivery with Ericsson customers and potential customers in the segment. Responsible for profitable business for Ericsson by translating customer needs and technology opportunities into detailed technical offering, solutions & proposals
Responsibilities & Tasks
Customer Asset Build:
Develop customer solutions using Ericsson product & service portfolio and utilizing 3PP products where applicable.
Support Business units in development of the Automotive offering
Support sales through campaigns and workshops with Engagement practices, Customer units, etc.
Support the Sales Team for the identification of key deals, supporting the preparation of the related Business Case and other documentation required, establish and track the sales funnel with the associated business figures
People Asset build:
Support the identification of resource requirements in the different parts of Ericsson sales and delivery organization, securing the availability of the required capabilities when and where they are needed
Identify training / competence build-up needs, drive enhanced knowledge management, e.g. best practices, communities, etc.
Contribute to internal competence development and communication, e.g. speeches, participation in events, on-line seminars etc.
Structural Asset build
Contribute to definition and evolution of Offering and Domain Portfolio Strategy
Adopt offering and contribute to offering development, harvesting reusable assets, working with Project Teams
Develop thought leadership in area e.g. participate in internal and external marketing events; write articles, white papers, etc.
Support the identification of selected 3rd Parties (Vendors, Systems Integrators, etc.), with the objective of establishing alliances and partnerships to support the offering strategy
Responsibilities & Tasks
Analyze customer technology, define business requirements & participate in risk analysis
Work with core team on list of potential activities & solutions
Develop technical presentations & proposals, & perform customer presentations
Support deployment of solution
Provide feedback to R&D
Participate in knowledge transfer, documentation & information sharing
Stay abreast of on new technology/technical areas & share information about solution to enable customer competence build
Position Qualifications
Core Competences:
Broad Technical Acumen
Consultative Selling Ability
Problem Solving Ability
Creative outside the box thinking
Presentation & Communication skills
Interpersonal skills building strong relations within and outside of Ericsson
Behavioral Competences:
Creating & Innovating
Entrepreneurial & Commercial thinking
Persuading & Influencing
Applying Expertise & technology
Analyzing
Delivering Results & Meeting Customer expectations
Preferred Skills:
Background as consultant with experience from consulting engagement covering Business, Operations and Technology aspects
Documented experience with industry standards such as TOGAF, ITIL etc.
IT architecture experience
Project Management skills
Minimum Qualifications & Experience Requirements:
Minimum 5 years of Professional Experience in Automotive industry
Substantial experience from Consulting engagements in ICT industry
Experience from technical roles, e.g. experience from work with Software development processes
Additional Requirements, Physical Demands, Region/Local Specifications:
The role involves extensive travel to customers, partners and other applicable stakeholders.
Location USA

Job Summary
The Sourcing Line Manager shall lead the Network Services sourcing team to develop cost effective Ericsson wide category strategies that are based on cross-functional requirements & business needs for RNAM. Through efficient sourcing of products, services & solutions, the Sourcing Line Manager shall strengthen Ericsson‰Ûªs competitive position by maximizing supplier value, proactively managing business risks & contributing to the creation of value for the Customer.
The Line Manager is responsible for leading the Network Services team that is accountable for evaluating and selecting suppliers, negotiating supplier contracts and pricing for services, supplier business intelligence, benchmarking practice & category market knowledge, establishing a cost effective & competitive market place that optimizes Ericsson‰Ûªs supplier business, and supporting stakeholders with supplier performance strategy and business. The role is also responsible for the Preferred Supplier List & internal compliance to it.
Through requirement alignment & opportunities from Sourcing & stakeholders, sustainable solutions fulfilling stakeholder requirements, policies, laws & regulations shall be secured.

Lead the Network Services contracting team

Supplier on-boarding.
Work with Engagement Practices and Operational Delivery Units as well as Customer Unit Sales teams to develop an effective supply chain to support the business.
Coordinate scopes of work with Delivery Units and work with legal to establish Task Orders.
Collaborate with Senior Management of Suppliers to develop positive and profitable relationships.
Team with other roles in the organization to achieve desired results.

Develop the long term business for the specific product / service

Solution Architect / Senior Solution Architect - Public Safety & Security
This is really exciting opportunity to join a world leading provider of communications technology and services whose offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet‰Ûªs greatest challenges.
Our client is strongly committed to leveraging on its existing portfolio and competence to address customer needs beyond the traditional Telco customer with a focus on Energy, Utilities, Transport, Automotive, Shipping and Public Safety & Security. The already existing team, which has expanded within Business Unit Global Services , will play a key role in helping to increase its‰Ûª market share across its‰Ûª regional landscape. They are looking for further industry experts and leaders to support the company in growing our sales in industry verticals.
In this role you will be reporting to Head of Safety & Security and be part of a global team with highly skilled industry experts within the domain of Public Safety & Security.
Your areas of responsibilities
Take the lead in analyzing, planning and designing comprehensive and complex technical solutions addressing customer needs within Safety and Security domain. In cooperation with Regional account teams you translate the customer needs into solution and services offering growing the global sales funnel.
Pro-actively engage with customers to position the company as a trusted partner through your expertise in designing solutions that lead to further development and improvement of the customers‰Ûª e-g organizations or processes enhancing their competitive position.
Drive development of services and solutions based on market needs, leveraging own and cross competence domains. Actively provide feedback on market insights on customer needs, market development and competitive situation to enhance the development of our offerings and value propositions.
Establish and maintain contacts with key decision makers in the customer organization on C-level in order to contribute to higher sales volumes.
Maintain knowledge of key competitor‰Ûªs and their future direction, and actively drive the translation of industry needs and trends into the development of a competitive portfolio in Safety & Security.
Drive up-sell opportunities during the entire process in order to contribute to increased sales volumes.
Select or propose 3rd party suppliers/products for the customer solutions work with and manage customized solutions including new 3rd party products.
Provide technical sales support and maintain knowledge of the complete services portfolio and solution offerings within Safety & Security.
Drive the global building of assets, including development and re-use of offerings, processes, methods and tools.
Contribute actively to best practice sharing and knowledge management in the regional and global Industry & Society community. This entails actively train and educate in the service portfolio.
Contribute to a professional services culture and way of working characterized by strong customer focus, proactive attitude, teamwork, and strong performance ethics.
Your background
Extensive experience and proven track record of technical sales support in the ICT professional services business focusing of Public Safety & Security, preferably with strong background in Disaster and Emergency Management or Blue Light services control room solutions.
Well established personal network within customers and partners in the Public Safety & Security sector on the regional market.
Solid understanding of customer strategic plans, eco systems, regulatory environment, major stakeholders and requirements for First Responders, eg police, fire, rescue, Public Safety Answering Points, eg 112/911 Emergency Response centers, National Disaster Coordination Centers and Border / Coast Guard organizations.
Experience and strong ability to engage with C-level in a consultative manner. Expert in listening, scoping and expanding customer issue into technical solutions generating sales.
Strong commercial acumen including profound ability in analysing and translating customer needs into concrete technical solutions resulting in revenue offerings.
Creative in terms of ability to see and make things in a new or different way, capability of developing inspiration, innovation or insight.
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to interface with all levels of the organization and an established relevant network within the company.
Proactive, self-motivating with a good grasp of the key business drivers.
Willing and available to travel frequently.
Fluent in English.
University degree in Business, or Engineering/ICT. Higher university such as an MBA considered a merit.

Job Summary
The Senior ITS Sales Executive Manager, reporting to the VP of Transportation Sales, will identify, build relationships, and close sales
opportunities across the Intelligent Transportation Systems space. ITS is where the Internet of Things combines with analytics to dynamically
optimize traffic, provide real-time actionable information to travelers, improve safety such as through automated slick location delivery, and a
wide variety of other use cases with more conceived daily.
Many of these ITS systems are being procured by Cities, frequently under the banner of a ‰ÛÏSmart City‰Ûù initiative. Others are statewide DOT
driven, while still more may be done through standalone enterprises, automobile collaborations, and organizations. The Senior ITS Sales
Executive will craft and execute a strategy to sell toward the various ITS segments in the US and Canada based on market readiness, offering fit,
and competitive environment.
Duties will include leveraging own existing network of contacts as well as the Ericsson Marketing team in order to find and qualify opportunities,
own the commercial aspects of each opportunity, and drive a matrixed team to closing each deal. Solution areas for sales focus shall include, but
not be limited to, the Ericsson Connected Traffic Cloud, Service Enablement Platform, analytics platforms and services, consulting services,
connectivity solutions such as microwave, network rollout and integration services, third party industry-specific applications, as well as cloud /
managed services.
Your responsibilities would include:
‰Û¢ Proactively Identify and qualify ITS opportunities into customers where Ericsson does not have an existing relationship
‰Û¢ Build relationships with the key stakeholders, decision makers, and sourcing teams within each customer.
‰Û¢ Generate and execute an ITS-focused sales strategy plan
‰Û¢ Work with internal offering leads to scope and price each solution at levels that are market accepting while maximizing margin.
‰Û¢ Report and make timely updates of status for all opportunities within Ericsson‰Ûªs CRM system
‰Û¢ Drive internal teams for the right solution to each customer
‰Û¢ Leverage/re-use global solutions where applicable
‰Û¢ Assist with deal gap closure, such as evaluating third parties
‰Û¢ Provide timely information to the appropriate groups regarding timing of OB, NS, and similar financial aspects of each deal
‰Û¢ Monitor competitors to detect new offerings and value proposition updates
Desired Experience/skills
‰Û¢ Pre-existing ITS sales is a must
‰Û¢ Demonstrated experience building lasting customer relationships
‰Û¢ Self-starter and able to work independently
‰Û¢ Demonstrated Add-on sales
‰Û¢ Able to identify opportunities across a wide range of offerings
‰Û¢ Comfortable in Microsoft Office applications, incl PowerPoint, Word, and Excel
‰Û¢ Articulate communicator
‰Û¢ Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Marketing, or Communications
*LI-NA1

Job Summary:
The Software Architect contributes, to create a customer‰Ûªs solution, in all phases of the software development lifecycle, towards properly engineered information systems, containing software as the major component, to meet agreed business requirements.
The Software Architect is responsible for ensuring that the delivered software components provide the necessary functionality and perform in accordance to the overall requirements and to the customer‰Ûªs expectation.
Responsibilities and Tasks:
åá Interact effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
åá Perform customer solution requirements analysis and translate into detailed software requirements and work packages (work breakdown structure).
åá Engage in technical conversations with customers to identify the best custom SW solution for their problem.
åá Assist sales teams in providing analysis, proposals, and cost estimates.
åá Design detailed software architecture for developers that consider cost, performance, availability, maintainability, scalability and reusability.
åá Specify the appropriate technologies to be used for customer solutions (HW, SW language, development frameworks, databases, operating systems, etc.)
åá Identify SDLC methodology to be used on a given project.
åá Contribute when necessary to the development activities including coding, debugging, and problem solving.
åá Stay current with the latest technologies that are being used for software development in the industry.
åá Provide input to management on competence and dimensioning for the organization.
åá Recommend and lead improvement initiatives.
åá Provide mentoring to members of the organization.
Desired Skills and Experience
Core Competences
åá Network Architecture
åá Solution development
åá Solution Integration
åá Solution support
åá Problem solving and strategic thinking
åá Risk Analysis
åá Administrative skills
åá Planning and organization skills
åá Ericsson knowledge
åá Risk management
Minimum Qualification and Experience Requirements
åá Expertise in Java/J2EE, Unix/Linux shell scripting, and SQL. Nice to have: C/C++, Perl, TCL, Expect, Python, etc.
åá Expertise in J2EE Web applications, Web Services, and Application Servers. Should have worked with JSPs, Servlets, XSLT, EJBs/MDB, JMS, SOA, XML, ESB, and Hibernate.
åá Expertise in Multi-threading, transactional and distributed systems.
åá Good networking concepts: TCP/UDP/SCTP sockets, IP, ICMP, IGMP, layer 3 routing, DNS
åá Good knowledge of software configuration management and continuous integration with tools such as ClearCase, Git, SubVersion, SONAR, Jenkins etc.
åá Knowledge of Data Modeling and Data Transformation: XML/XSD/XSLT.
åá Expert in Relational Databases with experience on at least two known databases: MySQL, Oracle, Sybase, DB2
Preferred Qualification and Experience Requirements
åá Strong personal interaction and people management skills.
åá Good collaboration capabilities
åá Knowledge of scripting languages such as Perl and Bash are a plus.
åá Working experience with Data Migration tools such as Pentaho or Informatica.
åá Expertise in architecting and implementing scalable, distributed and highly available database systems (ex. Oracle, SQL)
åá Knowledge of IT or telecom standards and protocols such as: Diameter, SIP, SDP, RTP, RTCP, SNMP, H248.
åá Java certifications.
åá Open Group ITAC (IT Architect Certification), Microsoft (MCA), IBM Rational software architect, or similar certification is preferred.

Program Director ‰ÛÒ Cloud
Ericsson is looking for senior managers and program directors in the area of Consulting and program delivery for Cloud solutions. These leaders will be accountable for managing complex and/or large programs, leading its program teams and interfacing with key customer contacts from its early pre-sales to delivery conclusion phases.
Responsibilities (PD):
Develop and execute on delivery strategy/processes from pre-sales to realization.
Drive planning, forecasting, dimensioning and optimization of delivery based on business needs for particular programs.
Responsible for the delivery of services (scope, cost, quality, time and customer satisfaction) within CSI from sales to delivery phase. Leading project and program activities in the analysis, architecture, planning, establishment (execution), realization (execution), handover (execution) and conclusion phases.
Assist and provide CSI SME knowledge for engagement and sales teams with regards to Architecture, delivery methodology, cost, scope, and risks of CSI activities and proper alignment of customer requirements.
Manage and motivate people in diverse teams and geography, both in a line and matrix capacity ‰ÛÒ including definition of teams, interviewing and selecting process.
Flexibility and ability to play different technical, project management and business roles as needed to ensure success of the program
Evaluate and manage third party relationships to ensure that margin levels are met and that the business case is being realized
Responsibility to capture add-on sales into client environments and develop and maintain strong and positive customer relationships
Identify and address the end to end implications of changes either in IT, network, operations, services or business models and creative corrective actions to preserve or improve program goals.
Responsibilities (additional if PD on leadership role):
Strategic and tactical planning as well as organizational alignment across CSI unit;
Competence, Resource and Performance Management;
Drive knowledge sharing and certification programs;
Minimum Education and Requirements
15 + years of experience, from within the Telco/Systems Integration Industry (consulting or Systems Integration) on driving Cloud transformation programs or projects of high complexity
Must have proven track record in leading Cloud type of Integration Engagements, at least 5 years of experience leading complex SI-Projects/Programs;
Well proven ability to transform customer requirements and expectations at a high level into a solution that Ericsson can realize as a customer engagement.
Strong financial knowledge/training.
Highly developed working knowledge of business process, including tender and sales
Excellent Consulting skills with a proven track record as a customer focused Senior Consultant.
In depth knowledge of the telecom industry, including a thorough understanding of economic/ commercial/political issues affecting the industry.
Excellent Leadership abilities proven through line manager or other comparable positions.
Proven ability to drive team engagements in a tough and time sensitive environment.
Results oriented. Able to work independently and take a logical and orderly approach to analyzing problems, organizing work and planning actions.
Strong ability to interact at the senior level; must have superior communication skills to influence others and meet deadlines while building strong relationships both internally and externally.
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines and problem solve in stressful situations.
Bachelors degree, preferably in a science, business or telecommunications discipline.
MBA, from a top university, preferred
Current PMP certification or is actively pursuing professional project management certification (PMP), recommended to be complete within 1 year
Demonstrate working knowledge of any specific equipment and/or materials used in the performance of the essential functions of the job: MS Outlook, MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Project, PROPS-C, Einstein, SAP, MORE tool.
Role expectations:
Develop relationships with senior internal stakeholders and at customers
Perform work on customer site and engage with customer teams at all levels.
Work in team settings with competitors and customers.
Ability to travel more than 50% as required or long stays at customer sites.
Work with less experienced staff in advancing their skill set.
Focus areas of domain expertise:
Cloud based solutions

The Role
In order to create products to move Ericsson into the IT/Hybrid Cloud market, we are forming small, incubator R&D teams aligned with key areas of the Cloud 2.0 architecture. The incubator teams will work to innovate, enhance and productize components and appliances for IT Cloud usage.
Our Distributed Cloud team has strong competence and extremely high ambitions. You are expected to bring your own ground-breaking ideas and to be passionate about turning them to reality. Everybody on the team needs to grasp the market pain-points, contribute to architecture and deliver code.
REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications Technical competence
- BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related field
- Have a minimum of 10 years as a software engineer
- Have a minimum of 5 years working on large-scale distributed systems
- Know, understand and are interested in distributed systems, scalability, operating systems, networking, automation and governance
- Have experience with open-source projects and a track record of contributions to open-source communities, for example, ZFS, CloudFoundry, Docker, Linux, OpenStack et al.
- Take pride in their code and appreciate feedback, discussion, and iteration with experience in driving a vigorous code review process
- Value testing and understand how to safely and continuously deploy into production environments
- Get a warm and fuzzy feeling from Postel‰Ûªs Law
- Write code in several languages (C, C++, Java, Go, node.js/javascript), have switched their main language at least once in their career and have expertise in C, Go and javascript.
- Experience in Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA and REST)
- Can describe the difference between concurrency and parallelism
- Prior success in automating a real-world production environment
Industry competence
- Possess a strong understanding of the cloud computing (datacenter, hardware, IaaS, PaaS, cloud services) industry
Leadership competence
- Have an entrepreneurial spirit
- Strong results orientation
- Thinks big
- Self-aware, self-motivated and self-learning and encourages the same in your teams
- Strong track record in people leadership
- Has passion and convictions and the innate ability to inspire passion in others
- Genuine interest in people and leading people
- Ability to lead, inspire and coach team members
- Expects and requires innovation of her/his team
- Encouraging learning and the sharing of best practice
- Excellent communication skills in English, spoken and written
- Ability to apply structure, simplify and drive change in a multi-site, multi- cultural environment
- Using data driven analyses to drive insight
- Has relentlessly high standards

Engagement Manager
Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help craft a more sustainable world.
We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & a creative & engaging environment where employees improve their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.
We welcome the opportunity to meet you!
Job Summary
Ericsson‰Ûªs North American Core & Cloud Engagement Practice is looking for a Senior level business developer/solutions architect with sales, business management, solution architecture and/or delivery experience developing significant new and existing business, crafting broad business solutions, and providing industry thought leadership in new areas of growth in areas of Information and Communications technology, Cloud/SDN/NFV and network technologies such as IMS, EPC. You will work with our sales organization and be accountable for driving new funnel opportunities, building compelling & competitive offers, and progressing large, strategic key deals forward to closure. You are comfortable organizing and leading business and technical discussions with customers from the technical level to the C-suite. You will also have experience in consultative selling, identification of strategic, budgeted programs, generating new business demand, and business case justification for new programs. You will develop/recommend technical solutions, detailed business cases and commercial strategies, based on the analysis of customer business goals, objectives and needs. You will have strong familiarity in communications service provider functional business process areas. The individual should drive the thought leadership, market requirements, offer development, and evangelize new creative solutions that address service provider needs and opportunities for instance in network transformation, IT and network convergence, cloud, NFV etc.
Key Responsibilities
Be a subject matter guide in Cloud, SDN/NFV solutions, including Ericsson and third party partner products
Meet with sales teams and customers to understand requirements and quickly and deeply propose and architect solutions
Lead direct and indirect, cross-functional teams, seeking assistance within a large, complex organization on proposals, offer development, demos, proofs of concepts, strategy development, 3rd party solutions, etc.
Thought leadership in the areas of communication evolution, virtualization, cloud, and transformation
Build strong relationships with Ericsson account management teams, key customer decision makers and influencers, Ericsson business units, third party partners, and other key partners
Drive the technical sales process and lead the crafting of comprehensive and complex technical solutions addressing customer needs for EPC, IMS and related technologies.
Identify market requirements in accordance to customer‰Ûªs requirements and feedback; identify strategic market requirements; Influence roadmap development.
Work with the product management groups and development organizations to secure development of solutions that meet the customer's needs in a timely manner.
Collaborate with strategy, marketing and delivery teams as well as global peer partnership on similar initiatives at other customer accounts to bring to bear experiences and new ideas across the organization.
Drive knowledge transfer among relevant communities within Ericsson
Collaborate with commercial management for offer development
In agreement with the Ericsson account team, initiating can-do customer engagements with existing and prospective customers
Support in developing & delivering customer presentations
Drive up-sell opportunities during the entire process in order to contribute to increased sales volumes.
Be up to date on Core and Cloud products and solution offerings.
Maintain knowledge of key competitor‰Ûªs product line and future direction.
Represent the Ericsson customer account on technical issues towards the Product Area.
Facilitate resources as needed to close large opportunities.
Competence
Broad end to end view of EPC, IMS, cloud ecosystem, and associated technologies such as User Data Management, WebRTC, MMTel, NFV, SDN, OpenStack, Service Level Orchestration, Automation. You should be very familiar with industry standards such as ETSI NFV, ONF, ODL, OCP, IETF, 3GPP and others.
Strong negotiation and argumentation skills
Dedication to long-term engagements & to prove Ericsson credibility in the field with successful business cases.
Strong understanding of IMS, User Data Management, Web Communications, and NFV related technologies
Strong background in solutions/consultative sales approach at the executive level with ability to translate business needs to product solutions
Keen understanding of the Network Service Provider technical challenges including knowledge of the end-user needs
Experience in carrier network transformation to Cloud, NFV and such technologies
Strong ability to work in a complex global environment, effectively building and sustaining relationships at multiple levels with the customer as well as internally.
Great teammate whom easily integrates in an existing team and has the ability to create the needed team to achieve the business objectives.
Strong presentation and communication skills are a requirement
Articulates arguments or ideas in a compelling way
Dedicated, self-motivated, organized and structured, with a good grasp of key business drivers
Willing and available to travel frequently in the region
Qualifications
BS Degree in engineering (IT, Telecom, Computer Science) and MBA preferred.
10 years of relevant ICT experience including relationship sales, product management or consulting
Minimum 5 years in leadership positions
Additional Requirements, Physical Demands, Region/Local Specifications:
This position is located in Plano, Texas

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Job Summary
The US is one of the key regions in which to grow the automotive OEM business. The US automotive OEMs, in particular, account for approximately 30% global market share in 2015 and are our key targeted customer group.
The candidate will focus on the technical solution architecture, solution delivery and the support of the sales process for the automotive customer segment.
The candidate will work very closely with one or more account managers to identify, build relationships, and close sales opportunities across connected vehicle space. Connected Vehicles is where the Internet of Things combines with horizontal platforms to provide end-to-end telematics, infotainment, and enhanced safety services to automotive end users in both the consumer and industrial sub-segments. Ericsson offers a wide range of platforms, solutions, and consulting services, as well as managed services that are directly applicable to this industry.
The candidate, in support of the account manager, will identify and drive technical solutions to fit the needs of the various consumer automotive OEMs, heavy machinery OEMs, after market players, industry suppliers, and services players in the US and Canada.
Duties will include generating solution architectures, identifying and filling solution gaps, working with the account manager in order to find and qualify opportunities, own the technical aspects of each opportunity, and drive a matrixed team to delivering on commitments. Solution areas for sales focus shall include, but not be limited to, the Ericsson Connected Vehicle Cloud, Service Enablement Platform, analytics platforms and services, consulting services, content management platforms, billing platforms, integration services, third party industry-specific applications, as well as cloud / managed services.
Responsible for profitable business for Ericsson by translating customer needs and technology opportunities into detailed technical offering, solutions & proposals.
Responsibilities & Tasks
Develop customer solutions using Ericsson the product and service portfolio as well as 3pp products
Act as owner of overall customer solution in delivery
Provide feedback to Business units in order to improve development of the Automotive offerings
Support the identification of resource requirements needed for successful presales and delivery of pursued opportunities
Contribute to external thought leadership through speeches, participation in events, on-line seminars etc.
Support the identification of 3rd Parties (Vendors, Systems Integrators, etc.), with the objective of completing Ericsson solution for customers
Responsibilities & Tasks
Identify which Ericsson offerings best fit the customer need
Scope, define & design solutions that match customer needs ; driving end-to-end technical solutions
Interact with customers as the primary technical solution consultant across the broad range of Ericsson offerings
Analyze customer technology, define business requirements & participate in risk analysis
Work as a key member of the core team on identifying and qualifying a sales funnel
Develop technical presentations & proposals, & perform customer presentations
Oversight of deployment of solutions to insure customer satisfaction
Provide feedback to R&D, BU, and operations
Participate in knowledge transfer, documentation & information sharing
Stay abreast of on new technology/technical areas & share information about solution to enable customer competence build

Core Competences:
Broad Technical Acumen
Consultative Selling Ability
Problem Solving Ability
Creative outside the box thinking
Interpersonal skills building strong relations within and outside of Ericsson
English Language Skill
Behavioral Competences:
Creating & Innovating
Entrepreneurial & Commercial thinking
Persuading & Influencing
Applying Expertise & technology
Analyzing
Delivering Results & Meeting Customer expectations

Background in IoT, M2M, and/or automotive software solutions with experience from technical sales or consultingDocumented experience with industry standards such as TOGAF,CAN
Ability to translate technical solutions into business value propositions
Existing awareness and knowledge of the Ericsson portfolio a plus
Ability to quickly absorb and assess the technology aspect of new offerings
Market and Project experience from Automotive customers

Experience from technical roles, e.g. experience from work with Software development processes

Job Summary
The Head of Channel Management will be based out of Ericsson headquarters in Plano, Texas. This position will drive significant revenue growth by establishing and building a channel business to the appropriate enterprise with Ericsson existing and yet to be available solutions and services. The leader of the Channel Management business is responsible for the strategy and execution of all aspects of the Channel Management organization.
The Channel Management team is accountable for winning, maintaining, and expanding relationships with Channel Partners and end customers. The Channel Management team is accountable for the strategic planning and oversight around innovation, development and maintenance of solutions and technologies for our business. Additionally, the Channel Management team is charged with growing the channel management portfolio, representing the entire range of solutions Ericsson brings to market and evaluating appropriateness for the enterprise space through channels. This person is responsible for all business development aspects of partnerships, with a primary focus on generating revenue.
A proven track record of success with the leading players in the channel space, exemplary sales skills, and vision and patience, are all critical factors to successfully supporting the exponential growth of the indirect sales team anticipated over the coming years. This will require significant travel, face time with channel partners and end customers within key verticals. Additionally working partner events and the ability to develop and execute a partner business plan. This is a high energy position requiring an individual to be extremely motivated and results-driven. The Head of Channel Management will lead in the channel sales team to identify, pursue, and engage with new & existing partners and end customers. It will be critical to successfully navigate internally to gain alignment to new ways of working across CU‰Ûªs, Bus and support functions. This is a highly visible and complex role, the candidate will be required to support and work cross functionally. The successful candidate must be passionate and proactive in driving channel accountability and growth.
This position will primarily be responsible for:
Drive North American channel sales to achieve growth targets for orders, net sales and margin.
Develop & Execute channel strategy and anchor strategy with key internal stakeholders
Develop business plan and secure stakeholder approval
Analyze market segments and determine products to sell through channel
Develop and manage channel partners, including selection of new partners and assessment of current ones.
Deliver the P&L of business: Sales, Orders, Margin. Oversee budget and resource allocation across channel team
Develop and manage a sales oriented organization that can expand our channel business including recruiting new talent and developing people within the team (sales coaching, guidance, career planning, mentoring)
Select targeted verticals and market segments and develop plans to address market trends, customer needs, primary economic levers, and industry trends
Advises Product Management teams on solutions appropriate for enterprise through channels
Working closely with product, channel, and customer teams to define key selling propositions that will then translate to all sales and marketing materials and client communications in order to lead marketing and positioning for the organization.
Marketing, business intelligence and new business development for our solutions
Requirements
10+ years sales experience with proven track record delivering sales targets and growing revenues..
10+ years technology vendor experience (wireless or IT experience preferred) selling into the channel space
Track record of building and executing strategies to build best in class channel partner results based on quantitative and qualitative market opportunity assessment.
Strong management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and set priorities. Must be able to lead and manage teams.
Ability to build relationships and influence cross functionally; coordinating and leading executive level sales meetings.
Great relationship skills, tenacity, resilience and inter-personal/presentation skills.
Experience managing and implementing proactive tactics to overcome channel conflict with direct sales.
Ability to work effectively across functional groups; CU, EP, BU, Operations.
Must have excellent oral and written communications skills including effective presentation and negotiation skills.
Proven ability to lead, balance, and self-manage multiple simultaneous projects and activities.
Must have excellent attention to detail, a commitment to quality and be results driven and customer focused.
Travel in North America 50%+.
Ability to craft a solution with appropriate products and services that meets business goals of the market place

Job Description:
As the Senior Solution Architect, you will work closely with the Cloud Center of Excellence technical and leadership team to define and deliver complex proof of concepts and customer solutions. You will be responsible for providing technical sales support to Ericsson Customer units and be the Cloud Subject Matter Expert for Key Customer Engagements. You will also be responsible for creating and developing the Cloud Services strategy along with the Cloud Center of Excellence Leadership team.
As our ideal candidate, you will possess the Cloud technical and sales expertise needed to lead the design, development and delivery of projects. You are a recognized leader within the Cloud industry and have contributed knowledge in the form of white papers, research articles, or patents.
At a commercial level, you will have built and deployed Cloud solutions in large scale environments. With proven experience overseeing all aspects of Cloud projects, your track record of identifying business opportunities and driving profitable success will be exceptional. Your outstanding relationship building skills and ability to develop strong working partnerships will lead you to success in this exciting opportunity.
Job duties include, but are not limited to, the following:
åá Provide high-level and detailed consultative solutions and technical sales support for selected customer opportunities. Understand business requirements and be able to translate them into technical requirements.
åá Perform in-depth and high-level technical presentations for customers, partners and potential clients.
åá Provide consultative support to Solution Architects and Service Engineers.
