Unit: BUCI DUIP Development Environment, China Continuous Integration & Delivery
Department Summary
By 2020, there will be 50 billion connections to the internet, whereby anything that can benefit from an internet connection will be connected (i.e. Networked Society). Over the last 3+ years Ericsson has invested billions of dollars to move from the #1 position in Wireless Infrastructure to take claim as the #1in end-to-end Converged Infrastructure. There are not many players that have end-to-end capability. There are a whole host of challenges you face when creating a single, fully converged, infrastructure that handles everything.
DUIP Development Environment is a central function with E2E Dev Env responsibility for entire DUIP product portfolios along this Ericsson 2020 journey. The China CID is based on Beijing with energetic talents focusing on Continuous Integration and Delivery. You will have the best opportunity to work with a great team and continuous learning opportunity to build up the best continuous integration platform.
Position Summary
The CD Engineer will report to China CID manager and work within a virtual agile team between CID Beijing and CID San Jose. It requires close cooperation with project office, system engineering, software design and I&V teams to perform software merge, build, label & release activities, manage branch strategy, maintain design/build environment, continuous integration framework and other tools. The scope covers but not limited to SSR, EVR, NHK and NFVi projects.
Responsibilities & Tasks:
The individual will be responsible for SCM daily operations within assigned projects including maintaining release contents, versions & baselines, compiling software with standard software build tools and packaging builds for release.
Participate in SCM planning, scheduling and documentation.
Maintain and support SCM environment including GIT/GERRIT, Jenkins, build automation scripts and etc.
Maintain and support design environment including SuSE Linux, Virtual Machines, Coverity, compiler and etc.
Maintain and support Continuous Integration framework based on Jenkins.
Coordination between development team and IT department for development environment maintenance.
General Qualification
Technic oriented people and be passionate for broader skills in software development and continuous integration.
Team work and good communication skills across multiple teams.
Be able to work independently and respond to multiple and conflicting requests under tight deadlines and in a dynamic working environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills in English. Clear mind, ability to break down complexity and communicate things in a clear manner.
Ability to learn new technologies quickly, identify and resolve issue, mindset of distributed system.
Innovated mindset to break routines and make continuous improvement.
Technical Qualification
Thorough understanding of Software Configuration Management and Continuous Integration principles. Experience in GIT/Gerrit/Jenkins usage, design and implementation is a must. Experience in other SCM/CI tools is a plus.
Familiar with Linux (Redhat, Ubuntu, SuSE) operation and administration. Experience in Virtualization (VMWare, VirtualBox, Openstack, Docker) is desired.
Good programming skills in Linux Shell, Perl, Python and Groovy. Experience in c/c++, Java and html programming languages is a plus.
Familiar with different open source tools, integration and deploy into development environment, including Jenkins, Elasticsearch/Logstash/Kibana, Ansible, Nagios, Puppet, Nexus, Artifactory, Maven and etc.
Knowledge and experience in machine learning and data mining is a plus.
Other Qualification
At minimum 3+ years software development working experience.
At minimum 2+ years Software Configuration Management (SCM) or Continuous Integration experience.
B.S. degree in Computer Science or equivalent is a must.
To apply for this position, please send your resume to rick.c.chen@ericsson.com.

Cloud Solutions Expert (f/m)
At Ericsson, our vision is Networked Society where every person and every industry is empowered to reach their full potential. Our strategy to achieve it is founded on three pillars: Mobility; Broadband; and Cloud. Ericsson will do with Cloud what we have so well achieved with Mobility: a globally-scaled infrastructure roll-out play.
The ambition is high. That is why we are seeking ambitious and experienced individuals to accelerate the momentum in our region, which is made up of 16 countries and includes the following: UK, Ireland, Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland, Austria, Poland, Hungary, Slovakia, Slovenia, Croatia and Czech Republic. Job summary
Looking for a Cloud Solution Architect who is passionate to design and implement Enterprise/IT Cloud solutions. Excellent opportunity to work with and develop cloud service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and architectures (Private, Public, Hybrid) for Enterprises, Telecom Operators, etc.
You will have opportunity to work for many Telecoms and Enterprises customers on complex projects including full systems integration involving different hardware and software solutions.

Act as Subject Matter Expert in specific technologies, product/service or solutions delivery
Design Cloud based solutions according customer requirements
Install and integrate Ericsson and other Cloud Solutions
Facilitate knowledge transfer to the customers during deployment projects
Work with the back-end teams to develop reliable solutions
Execute system tests
Create support documentation

Technical
Advanced knowledge of Cloud or Virtualization concepts and technologies
Working experience with deployment, configuration and operations of cloud management frameworks (OpenStack, CloudStack or VMware vCloud Director)
Working experience with some of virtualization platforms (VMware, KVM, XEN, Hyper-V)
Working experience with server infrastructure (blade systems or rack servers etc.)
Solid Linux system administration and troubleshooting skills
Good understanding of networking technologies and protocols
Advantage:
Practical experience with one of the following service architectures: AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Terremark, Rackspace, etc
Working experience with telecom specific cloud topics such as Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) or Management/Orchestration (MANO)
Working experience with some of enterprise storage systems - EMC, NetApp or similar
Knowledge of open-source storage solutions and distributed file systems
Experience working with Linux HA stack: pacemaker, corosync, keepalived

Knowledge of automation tools (Puppet, Chef)
ITIL knowledge
Soft

Solutions-focused: creative, curious, positive, collaborative

Product Development Unit Microwave has sites in Gothenburg and in Budapest. PDU MW pushes innovation and leads the product development in the area of Microwave transmission with high volume products such as MINI-LINK as well known trade marks.
We are looking for Minilink Traffic Node (TN) developers for the Budapest site. TN is a scalable, flexible, modular and robust u-wave transmission system used primarily in LRAN. The node is capable to carry both TDM and Ethernet traffic. TN uses Montavista linux and OSE operating systems, SW design is based on C and SDL. The current developments are going towards implementing the newest cutting edge Layer2 protocols and technologies.

Software development, implementation and test of new features

Securing high product quality
Ensure timely deliveries
Participate in solving customer issues

Good command of English
Sound knowledge of C
Good understanding of Linux and/or OSE
Ability to work in agile team (Scrum, Kanban)
Flexibility, quick learning
Advantages
Knowledge of network protocols (IPv4/6, SNMP, OSPF, STP, RSTP, TDM, ...)
Experience in concurrent programming
Java and scripting languages (PERL, bash, Python)
General telecom network knowledge preferably connected to microwave networks

Unit: BUCI DUIP Development Environment, China Continuous Integration & Delivery
Department Summary
By 2020, there will be 50 billion connections to the internet, whereby anything that can benefit from an internet connection will be connected (i.e. Networked Society). Over the last 3+ years Ericsson has invested billions of dollars to move from the #1 position in Wireless Infrastructure to take claim as the #1in end-to-end Converged Infrastructure. There are not many players that have end-to-end capability. There are a whole host of challenges you face when creating a single, fully converged, infrastructure that handles everything.
DUIP Development Environment is a central function with E2E Dev Env responsibility for entire DUIP product portfolios along this Ericsson 2020 journey. The China CID is based on Beijing with energetic talents focusing on Continuous Integration and Delivery. You will have the best opportunity to work with a great team and continuous learning opportunity to build up the best continuous integration platform.
Position Summary
The CD Engineer will report to China CID manager and work within a virtual agile team between CID Beijing and CID San Jose. It requires close cooperation with project office, system engineering, software design and I&V teams to perform software merge, build, label & release activities, manage branch strategy, maintain design/build environment, continuous integration framework and other tools. The scope covers but not limited to SSR, EVR, NHK and NFVi projects.
Responsibilities & Tasks:
The individual will be responsible for SCM daily operations within assigned projects including maintaining release contents, versions & baselines, compiling software with standard software build tools and packaging builds for release.
Participate in SCM planning, scheduling and documentation.
Maintain and support SCM environment including GIT/GERRIT, Jenkins, build automation scripts and etc.
Maintain and support design environment including SuSE Linux, Virtual Machines, Coverity, compiler and etc.
Maintain and support Continuous Integration framework based on Jenkins.
Coordination between development team and IT department for development environment maintenance.
General Qualification
Technic oriented people and be passionate for broader skills in software development and continuous integration.
Team work and good communication skills across multiple teams.
Be able to work independently and respond to multiple and conflicting requests under tight deadlines and in a dynamic working environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills in English. Clear mind, ability to break down complexity and communicate things in a clear manner.
Ability to learn new technologies quickly, identify and resolve issue, mindset of distributed system.
Innovated mindset to break routines and make continuous improvement.
Technical Qualification
Thorough understanding of Software Configuration Management and Continuous Integration principles. Experience in GIT/Gerrit/Jenkins usage, design and implementation is a must. Experience in other SCM/CI tools is a plus.
Familiar with Linux (Redhat, Ubuntu, SuSE) operation and administration. Experience in Virtualization (VMWare, VirtualBox, Openstack, Docker) is desired.
Good programming skills in Linux Shell, Perl, Python and Groovy. Experience in c/c++, Java and html programming languages is a plus.
Familiar with different open source tools, integration and deploy into development environment, including Jenkins, Elasticsearch/Logstash/Kibana, Ansible, Nagios, Puppet, Nexus, Artifactory, Maven and etc.
Knowledge and experience in machine learning and data mining is a plus.
Other Qualification
At minimum 3+ years software development working experience.
At minimum 2+ years Software Configuration Management (SCM) or Continuous Integration experience.
B.S. degree in Computer Science or equivalent is a must.
To apply for this position, please send your resume to rick.c.chen@ericsson.com.

Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.
We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.
Job Summary
As a member of the core Big Data and Analytics practice, you will work with Top Talent, across the Globe, in new and cutting edge technologies to develop the intuitive solutions of the future. The Team in Ericsson creates solutions which will influence the future of living and enables our customers to create intuitive and personalized products for the marketplace. A few illustrative solutions areas are the Internet of Things, Next gen Networks and Intuitive Customer Experience, Next best action and Connected Cars. You will work collaboratively with diverse teams of Business Analyst, Big Data Architects and Data Scientists and contribute to generating actionable insights and thereby converting data into knowledge of commercial/Societal value.
Responsibilities & Tasks :
Must have a strong understanding of the design, development and deployment of business intelligence systems and large scale data warehouses using BI tools and commercial database platforms like Oracle, SQLServer and Teradata. Working experience with Big data ecosystem will be considered as added advantage.
Ability to transform business level requirements to efficient dashboards and visualizations
Create data warehouse design patterns, designs, standards, and templates
Identify problems, develop ideas and propose solutions within differing situations requiring analytical, evaluative or constructive thinking in daily work and for assigned programs and projects
Prepare and present ideas and recommendations to colleagues and upper management
Apply conceptualized and creative-thinking expertise toward possible reporting solutions or alternatives
Hands-on development using Tableau/Tibco Spotfire to create dashboards & reports and use as standard templates
Define and implement BI management procedures
Design and implement BI metadata and data dictionary design and standards
Define and manage schema objects for Tableau /Tibco Spotfire projects
Document systems through object models, data definitions and naming conventions
Ability to write reports, documentation and speak effectively before groups of business and IT personnel
Should be able to articulate issues and solutions clearly and be a very good communicator with excellent Oral/written, presentation and articulation skills.
Desired Skills and Experience :
Must possess Seven (7+) years of experience in Information Technology with a technical background
Four (4+) years of experience in BI reporting Development (2+) years of experience in developing Tableau / Tibco Spotfire based business intelligence systems and large scale data warehouses
Understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence concepts
Must have strong Tableau / Tibco Spotfire and database skills
Must be able to travel to client locations
Required Personality Traits :
Ability to quickly learn new concepts/technologies with minimal handholding
Good collaboration and communication skills
Excellent problem solving skills and ability to shape an undefined problem statement
Strong sense of team work, ownership, and accountability
Takes initiatives and self-motivated
Job Location : Kolkata/Delhi/NCR

Ericsson Overview
Ericsson is worldâ€™s leading provider of communications technology and services. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planetâ€™s greatest challenges.
Ericsson is strongly committed to leveraging on its existing portfolio and competence to address customer needs beyond the traditional Telco customer with a focus on Energy, Utilities, Transport, Automotive, Shipping and Public Safety & Security.
We are now looking for further industry experts and leaders to support us in growing our sales in industry verticals.
In this role you will be reporting to Head of Global Safety & Security Global practice and be part of a global team with highly skilled industry experts within the domain of Safety & Security.
This position can be based in Bucharest/Romania OR Sofia/Bulgaria.
Job Summary
Drive or participate in customer engagements from lead generation to contract fulfillment, secure that consulting projects are fulfilled with quality, in time & within budget. Work closely with the customer to be able to propose improvements & identify new business opportunities.
Responsibilities & Tasks
Perform Pre-Sales Activity and Business Development in Public Safety and National Security
Continuously identify innovate profitable business opportunities
Analyze customer & user offerings, market scenarios, customer go to market strategy.
Drive pre-sales & sales engagements
Perform up-selling & identify add-on sales opportunities
Deliver consulting projects, managing risks & time within consultant assignments
Share project learning & contribute to Thought Leadership
Develop consulting practice capabilities

Behavioral Competences:

Minimum Qualifications & Experience Requirements:

Relevant experience in the Defence and Security Industry in South East Europe countries or the Mediterranea Region
Good understanding of the Public Safety and National Security market in Europe
Experience in the design and delivery of complex systems and roll out projects
Proven experience in projects in one or more of the following Security areas: Disaster and Emergency Management, Border / city protection, Mission Critical Communications, such as Tetra, as lead solution architect or Project manager
Excellent command of English is mandatory
Fluent French would be very good to have
Location: Bucharest or Sofia
